perturbation.original_text: i-on will maintain the operation of the Hosted Site continuously, twenty-four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days per week, including holidays, with the exception of reasonable hardware and software maintenance that must be performed on the Hosting Computer and/or the Hosted Site. i-on will use best efforts to schedule and perform such maintenance between the hours of 8pm and 8am Eastern Standard Time on weekdays, or during weekends.
perturbation.changed_text: i-on will attempt to maintain the operation of the Hosted Site continuously, with exceptions for maintenance. i-on will try to schedule maintenance during off-peak hours.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'will maintain' with 'will attempt to maintain' weakens the obligation. Removing the specific hours for maintenance introduces ambiguity, and can be contradictory to business continuity standards. It is ambiguous on what the exceptions might include.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law requiring clear and definite terms; potential conflict with reasonable expectations of uptime for hosted services.

perturbation.original_text: The Customer shall comply with applicable laws, standards, policies, and procedures. The Customer incurs the responsibility to determine what restrictions apply and to review the policies and procedures that will be updated continually. The customer is responsible to use the resources with sensitivity to the rights of others. Any conduct by the Customer that in i-on's sole discretion restricts or inhibits any other user, whether a customer of i-on or a user of any other system, from using and enjoying any of i-on's services is strictly prohibited. This includes, but is not limited to, the posting or transmitting on or through any of i-on's services, any information that is, in i-on's sole discretion, unlawful, obscene, threatening, abusive, libelous, or harmful, or encourages conduct that would constitute a criminal offense, give rise to civil liability, or otherwise violate any local, state, national, or International law.
perturbation.changed_text: The Customer should endeavor to comply with laws, standards, policies, and procedures. The Customer should consider the applicable restrictions and review updated policies and procedures periodically. The customer should attempt to use the resources with sensitivity to the rights of others. Conduct by the Customer that restricts any other user from using i-on's services may be discouraged. This includes posting information that is potentially unlawful or harmful.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall comply' to 'should endeavor to comply,' 'incurs the responsibility' to 'should consider,' 'is responsible' to 'should attempt,' and 'is strictly prohibited' to 'may be discouraged' weakens the mandatory nature of the obligations. Replacing 'in i-on's sole discretion' with a weaker statement removes clear standards, and the word 'potentially' is vague, contradictory to laws about harmful language.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Florida laws regarding contractual obligations and standards of conduct; potential conflict with laws prohibiting certain types of speech or conduct online.

perturbation.original_text: i-on will not be liable under any circumstances for any lost profits or other consequential damages, even if i-on has been advised as to the possibility of such damages. i-on's liability for damages to the Customer for any cause whatsoever, regardless of the form of action, and whether in contract or in tort, including negligence, shall be limited to one (1) month's fees and the remaining portion of any prepaid fees.
perturbation.changed_text: i-on may not be liable under certain circumstances for lost profits or other consequential damages. i-on's liability for damages to the Customer shall be limited to a nominal amount.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'will not be liable under any circumstances' to 'may not be liable under certain circumstances' introduces ambiguity. Replacing the specific limitation of liability (one month's fees) with 'a nominal amount' makes the limit vague and unenforceable. The definition of 'certain circumstances' and 'nominal amount' are not clear, this is contradictory to consumer protection laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Florida laws regarding limitation of liability clauses; potential issues with enforceability due to vagueness and unconscionability.
